text: basic English grammar lesson 3 topic the
simple past tense
part 2 recognizing and understanding the
simple past tense up till now we've been
focusing a lot on the forms of the
simple past tense it's time to talk more
about what the simple past tense means
we often use the simple past tense to
describe a finished action example she
put the candy back we're focusing on the
completion of the action not the process
we also use the simple past tense to
describe a series of actions meaning one
after the other example she put the
candy back picked up the Apple and began
to eat it here we have a series of three
actions put picked up and began to eat
watch listen and answer this time you
will watch the same video from part one
but you will answer questions about why
the simple past tense is used
question 1 Jennifer was at the kitchen
table what does the verb was tell us
choose a or b answer B a past state or
condition question 2
she wanted to eat something what does
the verb want to tell us answer B a past
State or condition
question three she took out a piece of
candy what does the verb talk tell us
answer a a past action
question four she put the candy back and
took the Apple what did the verbs put
and took tell us answer a the actions
were finished
question 5 that was a good choice what
does the verb was tell us
answer be Jennifer had a choice in the
past
she made it bonus question Jennifer
didn't eat the candy did she eat the
candy answer B no the last question you
answered was about recognizing and
understanding the simple past tense in
the negative we used did not plus the
base verb for example did not take did
not see did not look the contraction or
short form is didn't so didn't take
didn't see didn't look these short forms
are used in informal writing and
speaking the exception is the verb to be
the full forms are was not were not and
the contractions are wasn't weren't now
let's try an exercise to review
everything that we've learned so far
exercise for review correct the mistake
in each statement example I were at home
yesterday
the mistake were the correction was
now you try to find the mistakes and
make the corrections number one my
brother visited me last night the
mistake visited the correction visited
with won t this is a spelling mistake -
my brother and I was hungry mistake was
the correction were my brother and I
that's a compound subject 3 I cooked
dinner in the kitchen and then my
brother carried everything to the dining
room the mistake carried the correction
carried with an eye another spelling
mistake for we eat it soup steak and
potatoes mistake eaded correction 8 eat
is an irregular verb 5 we didn't had
dessert mistake had correction didn't
have we need didn't plus the base verb
ok we're not quite done yet with this
lesson please go on to the next part so
we can talk about asking questions in
the simple past tense
